visualization.name: Multiple Sequence Alignment
visualization.help:
### What is Multiple Sequence Alignment?
This tool provides an **interactive multiple sequence alignment (MSA) viewer** powered by `alignment.js`. It is designed to work with FASTA-formatted alignments and enables users to explore conserved regions, positional variation, and sequence layout in a browser-friendly interface.
#### Key Features
- **Interactive Zoom & Scroll**: Navigate large alignments efficiently. - **Axis Labels & Site Indexing**: Visual indicators for sequence names and site positions. - **Color-Coding**: Residues are color-coded by type for easy interpretation. - **Sequence Centering**: Automatically centers the view on a selected sequence or site. - **Linked Scrolling**: Labels, sites, and sequences stay synchronized when scrolling.
#### Supported Input
- **FASTA** format with aligned sequences (e.g., output from Clustal, MAFFT, or MUSCLE)
To use this tool, select a compatible dataset (FASTA alignment) from your history and launch the visualization.
Learn more about the underlying viewer at: [https://github.com/veg/alignment.js](https://github.com/veg/alignment.js)
